definition: to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: Complete disintegration of cytoplasm at stage of vacuolated microspore.
sentences.chinese: 单核液泡期的小孢子细胞质完全解体。

sentences.english: In male flowers, style cells containing no calcium precipitation soon began to degenerate.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏钙沉淀颗粒的雄花花柱细胞迅速解体。

sentences.english: Under these conditions, ethnic family patterns were slowly broken down by an increasingly urbanized, industrialized environment.
sentences.chinese: 工业化的日益发展，种族家庭的模式缓慢地解体。

sentences.english: In such a multi-ethnic country that would be a recipe for further disintegration.
sentences.chinese: 而那将给这样一个多民族国家的进一步解体埋下伏笔。

sentences.english: But the pragmatists were saying this is good for China.
sentences.chinese: 但是现实主义者说苏联解体对中国是有利的。

sentences.english: The government should allow orderly dissolution for dying businesses.
sentences.chinese: 政府应该允许奄奄一息的企业有序地解体。

sentences.english: On paper this produced “nations” that declared independence when the USSR collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 理论上，此举产生了苏联解体后宣布独立的“国家”。

sentences.english: Formed shortly after the breakup of the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 这个恐怖组织成立于前苏联解体之后。

sentences.english: After the disintegration of the Soviet Union, the guard post was moved to the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier beside.
sentences.chinese: 苏联解体后，这个哨位被移到了无名烈士墓旁。

sentences.english: Today, I announce the breakup of India, inshallah.
sentences.chinese: 真主保佑，今天，我宣布印度解体。

sentences.english: Following the breakup of Austria-Hungary, a Slovak Soviet Republic was created for a very short time.
sentences.chinese: 奥匈帝国解体后，很快建立了一个斯洛伐克共和国。

sentences.english: China's feudal legal system came into its both perfection and decline in the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 中国封建法政体制至清代臻于完善并开始解体。

sentences.english: But when that ancient continent broke up, life got lusher .
sentences.chinese: 但是，当这一古老的大陆解体时，生命变得更加繁盛。

sentences.english: Disintegrates over 5 hours for timed-release benefit.
sentences.chinese: 解体超过5小时，定时释放受益。

sentences.english: After awhile, sometimes all that remains of the male are his gonads.
sentences.chinese: 一段时间以后，雄鱼便会解体得只剩下生殖腺。

sentences.english: After the former Soviet Union disintegrates, "pirate flag", but near drifts strictly funds pressure.
sentences.chinese: 前苏联解体后，“海盗旗”而临严霏的经费压力。

definition: to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
to rupture/to fracture/to break down/(linguistics) plosion
to split up/to divide/to break up/fission/schism
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
